Henricus Octavus Dei gracia Anglie et Francie Rex
ffidei defensor et dominus hibernie Omnibus ad quos presentes littere pervenerint. Salutem. Sciatis quod nos considerantes pium propositum dilectorum nobis Thome West militis domini
la Warr Georgii Croft Capellani nostri Roberti Thorne Nicholei Thorne Ville noste Bristollie et Johannis Godryche clerici executoris testamenti Roberti Thorne defuncti in fundacione continuacione
et supportacione cuiusdam Scole gramaticalis in dicta Villa Bristollie aut in suburbiis eiusdem Ville pro pueris in eadem Scola erudiendis in bonis moribis et litteraturis pro meliori sustentacione
unious magistri et unius hostiarii sive duorum hostiariorum eisudem et aliarum rerum necessariarum ibidem faciendi ac gracia nostra speciali ac ex certa sciencia et mero moti nostris concessimus et
licenciam dedimus ac per presentes concedimus et licenciam damus pro nobis et heredibus et heredibus nostris quantum in nobis est maiori burgensibus et commutati dicte Ville Bristollie et successoribus
suis quod ipsi et sucessores sui acquiere et recipere possint domum sive hospitale sanct Bartholomei in dicte villa nostra Bristollie domina maneria mesuagia terras tenementa Gardina pomaria
prata pasturas pasturas redditus reveriones servicia cum omnibus suis iuribus proficuis et commoditatibus que nunc sunt aut aliquo tempore preterito acceptum sive reputatum fuerunt ut parcella euisdem
hospitalis aut que predictus Georgius Croft magister hospitalis predicti habuit tenuit aut gavisus fuit in iure eiusdem hospitalis tam in dicta villa Bristollie quam in parchocia de Clyfton
Stapulton Godbury Sodbury? et Wyckewarr in Comitatu nostro Gloucestrie seu alibi in Comitatu nostro Gloucestrie sei alibi in comitatu predicte Ville Bristollie Gloucestrie aut alibi infra Regnum nostrum Anglie ad annuum valorem quadraginta librarum ultra
omnia onera et reprisas tam de prefato Thoma West milite domino laWarr vero patrono et fundatore hospitalis predicti quam de predicto Georgio Crofte magistro ac custode domus sive hospitalis predicti et de fratribus et sororibus eiusdem domus sive hospitalis vel de eorum aliquo aut de quibuscumque aliis personis habentes sive habere pretendentes aut imposterum aliquo tempore habere contigerit aliquod ius titulum aut
possessionem usum vel intresse de et in premissis vel aliqua inde parcella licet de nobis in capite vel aliter aut de aliis personis vel persona mediate vel immedediate teneantur habendua habenda? sibi et successoribus suis imperpetuum. Et
eidem persone siue eisdem quod ipsi domum siue hospitale predictam domanica maneria terras et tenementa ac cetera premissa cum suis pertinenciis Maiori Burgensibus et Communitati Ville predicte et Succesoribus
suis predictus as annuum valorem predictum in forma predicta dare concedere legare vel assignare possunt et valeant. Similiter licenciam dedimus et concessimus ac damus concedimus specialem per presentes Absque
impedimento impeticione seu grauamine nostri heredum vel successorum nostrorum Justiciariorum Escaetorum Vicecomitum Ballivorum seu aliorum Ministrorum quorumcumque Volumus insuper et concedimus per presentes eisdem Maiori et
Burgensibus et Communitati Ville Bristollie predicte et Successoribus suis quod ipsi et successores sui Habeant et obtineant aut habere et obtinere possint tam presentes littras nostras patentes quam omnia et omnimoda breuia ac
littras regias executorias et confirmatorias in hac parte de tempore in tempus faciendo et exequendo. Absque aliquo seu feodo inde in Cancellaria nostra heredum vel succesorum nostrorum sue in hanaperio eiusdem Cancellaria nostra aut alibi
quoquo modo taxando imponendum faciendo solvendo siue capiendo Et quod siue Clericus Hanapii predicti aut eius deputatus ibidem pro tempore existens inde quietus et in Compto suo ad Scaccarium nostrorum reddendo
exonerati existant imperpetuum Statuto de terris et tenementis ad manum mortuam non ponendum Aut aliquibus aliis statutus actibus ordinacionibus restrictionibus siue mandatis incontrarium factis editis siue ordinatis aut faciendis siue ordinandis. Aut
aliqua alia causa re vel materia quacumque non obstantibus. Et absque aliquo breui seu breuibus nostris heredum vel successorum nostrorum de ad quod dampnum pro premissis vel aliquo premissorum prosequendo vel faciendo Aut eo quod expressa mentio de
certitudine premissorum seu de aliis donis siue concessionibus per nos aut aliquem progenitorum nostrorum prefatis Maiori Burgensibus et Communitati Ville predicte et succesoribus suis antea factis in presentibus littris nostris patentibus
minime facta existit in non obstantibus In cuius rei testimonium has littras nostras fieri ferimus patentes. Teste me ipso apud Chelsehith decimo septime die Marcu Anno regni nostri vicesimo tercio. Popeley
Per breve de priuato sigillo et de data predicta auctoritate parliamenti

Henry the Eighth, by the grace of God, King of England and France, defender of the faith and lord of Ireland. To all those whom these present letters shall come. Greetings. Know that we considering the blessed purpose of our beloved to us Thomas West, knight, lord La Warr, George Croft our chaplain, Robert Thorne, Nicholas Thorne of our town of Bristol and John Godryche, clerk, executor of the will of Robert Thorne, deceased, in the foundation, continuation and support of a certain grammar school in the said town of Bristol or in the suburbs of the same town for children in the same school to be instructed in good customs and learning for the better maintenance of one master and one usher or two ushrs of the same and other things requisite in the same place made of our special grace and our certain knowledge and mere motion we have granted and given license for us and our heirs in so far as we are able to the mayor, burgesses and commonality of the saids town of Bristol and their successors that themselves and their successors be able to acquire and receive the house or hospital of Saint Bartholomew in our said town of Bristol, and the demense lands, manors, messuages, lands, tenements, gardens, orchards, meadows, pastures, pastures, rents, reversions, services with all their rights, profits and advantages which are now or any time past have been accepted or considered or parcel of the same hospital or which the said George Croft master of the said hospital had held or was enjoying in right of the same hospital in the said town of Bristol and in the parish of Clyfton, Stapulton, Sodbury and Wyckwarr in our county of Gloucestershire or elsewhere in the county of the said town of Bristol of Gloucestershire or elsewhere within our kindom of England to the yearly value of forty pounds over and above all charges and deductions both of the said Thomas West knight lord La Warr true patron and founder of the said hospital and of the said George Crofte master and custodian of the said house or hospital and of the brothers and sisters of the same house or hospital or of any of them or of whichever other persons or person having or claiming to have or anytime in the future should happen to have some right, title, possession, right or interest of and in the premisses or any parcel thereof although is held of us in chief or of other persons or person directly or indirectly; to be held to themselves in perpetuity. And the same person or persons that they themselves are able and can give, grant, bequeth or assign the said house or hospital, demense lands, manors, lands, tenements and other premisses with their appurtenances to the mayor, burgesses and commonality of the said town and their aforesaid successors to the said yearly value in the said form. Similarly we gave and granted and we give special licence by the presents without hinderance, claim or injury of our heirs or successors, of our justices, escheaters, sheriffs, bailiffs or of other our ministers whatsoever. As mentioned above we wish and grand by the presents to the same mayor and burgesses and commonality of the said town of Bristol and their successors that they their successors may have and possess or many they be able to have or possess both our present letters patent and all and every kind of writ and royal letters of execution and confirmation which is to be made and done from time to time. Without any fine or fee in whatever was taxed, imposed, made, paid or taken therefore in our Chancery, our heirs and successors, or in the Hanaper of the same our Chancery and elsewhere. And that the keeper or clerk of the aforesaid Hanaper or his deputy in the same place for the time being shall be quit thereof and shall be exonerated forever in their account which is to be returned to the Exchequer. The statutes of not putting lands and tenements in mortmain or any other statutes, acts, ordinances, restrictions or mandates made, proclaimed or ordained or which is to be made or ordained to the contrary or any other cause, thing or matter whatsoever not withstanding. And without other or writ or writs of ad quod dampnum `to what damage' our heirs and successors, which is to be prosecuted or madefor the premisses or any premisses. Or that express mention is not made on ourpresent letters patent of the certainty of the premisses or of other gifts, concessions formerly made by us or other of our ancestors to the mayor, burgesses and commonality of the aforesaid town of Bristol and their successors, in anywise not withstanding. In witness of which thing we have caused these letters to be made patent. Witnessed by myself at Chelsea the seventeenth day of March the twenty third year of our reign. Popeley. By the writ of the privy seal and of the date aforesaid. By authority of Parliament.
